ratings.comment: Solid teacher. Subject is fairly interesting but not very challenging. As such, many students ended up skipping or zoning out during class. She tries her best to spice up lectures but gets flustered easily.  Tests are easy.

Andrea is smart professor but scatterbrained. Lectures are great but not always clear. However, she is more than helpful at office hours & exams are extremely fair. Lecture and discussion not mandatory. 2 midterms (better score counts), cumulative final, 5 graded homework assignments (4 best scores count). Clear that she wants students to succeed.

She is a nice person and she really knows her stuff. However, her lectures are boring and she always look very disorganized. She tends to talk too much in class. You are better off just reading her slides on your own, which she posts online. She willing to stop and answer questions in lecture though. Overall, average professor but not the worst.

I recommend a different course. Discussion was 20 times more helpful than lecture. Andrea is not a top professor, she almost seems scared when lecturing, but she does really want students to succeed, almost too much. All in all, I didn't find the class difficult, but also didn't find the material interesting at all, which is the reason I took it..

Andrea's lectures are kind of unclear and she seems flustered at times but you can tell that she truly wants her students to succeed. 5 homework sets, 2 exams (the better grade is the only one that counts) and a final. Discussion optional. Her office hours are SUPER helpful so take advantage of them!
Go to class, she explains better in class than in her powerpoints posted. Midterm was super difficult but made up for an easy final.

Definitely take her if you have the chance. She's extremely smart and just an overall great teacher. She also sympathizes with students who don't understand the material and bends over backwards to help them.

She's a visiting professor from NYU. Not much to complain about. She mumbles a bit, slides are good, prep sheet for exams were great. But didn't learn a ton. She seems to omit a bunch of stuff you'd expect to learn in intermediate microecon. If you wanna be a hardcore econ major, try a different professor.

Andrea is an interesting professor. You can tell she really loves economics and she's very intelligent, but she struggles in getting information across in an understandable manner. Her lectures are all over the place. Similarly, the review tests and sheets are not representative of the content on the tests. I somehow ended up with a B. Good luck.

390 Psych and Econ renamed to Behavioral economics 455.  Professor Wilson's class is one that I would strongly recommend. The material challenges your perspective of standard economics. Her lectures can be a little all over the place but you can tell she is extremely intelligent. She is very student orientated and is always searching for feedback

Lectures are interesting and she pays attention to how well the class is understanding the material.  Very generous curve based off of understanding general concepts instead some the of the specific difficult ideas. Overall I learned a lot and would definitely recommend to anyone interested in the topic.

The whole psychology and economics is applicable to real life but hard to model.   Final was very hard and just trying to understand what she is asking is sometimes a challenge. Very generous curve though. Easy homework and not much of it. Easy A, AB if you put in a little effort. Also sit near the front because her handwriting on board is bad!
